value: The city of Goma has been threatened by nearby rebels since November 2012, even occupying Goma for a short time. After months of relative calm, the rebels once again have threatened to capture Goma, as of July 2013. In addition to the threat posed directly from violence, the city is facing a large refugee influx, and the nearby threat has forced many Westerners to leave and many businesses have closed. (

value: — This volcano, famous for its lava lake, is a technically easy climb from the direction of Goma. A trip to the top should take ~6-8 hours, so most climbers spend the night at the top. Entrance permits cost US$100. The park was closed  in May 2009 due to the rebel occupation but was reopened in March 2010. The permit is now $200.

content=Offers a 2-day  climb and tour of Goma. Owner is a native of the region and very friendly, but it can take time to track him down. It's better bring your own equipment when trekking the volcano as the stuff Hakunamatata tours provide is of low quality (e.g. leaking tents)

Goma has many kinds of Congolese beers such as Primus, Mitzing and Turbo King.

The proverbial Congolese nightlife is superb, and Goma is no different. In many nightclubs the tunes are a mix of local and western, and so are the Punters.

The biggest danger in Goma during the day is crossing the busy roads. At night don't walk anywhere besides the main nightclub zone of Blvd Kanyamuhanga. It is advised to not leave valuables in hotels. Rebels have been responsible for killings of gorillas and the security situation remains precarious within the Virunga Park.
